They have emails between him and refuge occupiers about constructing a shadow government with their beliefs as basis for law there. His JOB dictates he follows laws as written. While he did not violate a specific law he enabled others, encouraged others and offered comfort and aid to obvious law breakers thru his office as Sheriff. Upon determining the extent of his participation thru this investigation will determine if charges apply. Either way, the ethics of his oath were broken by his own statements regarding this situation that he so proudly shared on video. Supporters of his actions would not be so quick to support his personal beliefs if they conflicted with their own. As Sheriff, his personal beliefs must be set aside in pursuit of rule of law. Put the shoe on the other foot and contemplate if someday his OPINION on a matter led him to arrest someone based on his OPINION rather than law. This would be fascist. Something we must guard against as a nation with rule of law.

First off you don't see emissions coming out of the tailpipe you see steam and particulates and emissions are gases that are usually colorless unless they are in a concentrated area( could be wrong) . The idea this kid has that he wants to do is good but the way he's trying to go about doing it is completely WRONG( if I am mistaken please correct me but they did not really explain how it was supposed to work in the video). Photosynthesis cannot occur without light and the device he's building is completely sealed from light, unless this device uses some high heat resistant algae that doesn't use light they will be killed by the heat of the engine. The algae have to be resistant to the steam the nitric acid , unburned hydrocarbons and the CO that come out of the tailpipe which would take the acid level out of viable range unless he is using extreme volcanic algae. This idea would be better suited in some kind of air purification tower rather than the end of somebody's tailpipe.

If anything, evolution is evidence of a divine order. There really isn't any other way for it to have worked. Random chance is too random to have worked so well so quickly. People that truly understand science are some of the most certain of us that there is a God, a creator, an artificer. If the beauty of creating a world like ours over billions of years isn't more powerful to you than doing it in seven days, you need to reevaluate your perspective.
